s2.title: SCMPrint
s2.p: SCMPrint shows how to access the Schema Content Model information.

s3.title: Running SCMPrint
s3.p: This program parses the specified XSD file, then shows how to access the Schema Content Model information.
s3.source:
Usage: SCMPrint [options] <XSD file | List file>
This program loads XML Schema file(s), to show how one can access the Schema Content Model information.
Options: -f Enable full schema constraint checking processing. Defaults to off. -l Indicate the input file is a List File that has a list of XSD files. Default to off (Input file is a XSD file). -? Show this help.
s3.p: Here is some sample output from SCMPrint (as the output is verbose it has been truncated)
s3.source:
